headline: Trump Announces $100K Fee for H-1B Visas. How Big Tech Companies Could Be Affected.
summary: The Trump administration on Friday issued a proclamation adding a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas, a special type of employment visa for highly skilled workers.  Big Tech companies are major users of these types of visas.  Six companies–  Alphabet Amazon.com Apple Meta Platforms Microsoft  and  Nvidia  –used 35,000 of the 85,000 available H-1B visas in the 2025 fiscal year.

headline: New iPhone 17 unveiled in Moscow, as pre-orders jump despite slowing economy
summary: MOSCOW (Reuters) -Russian resellers unveiled Apple's new iPhone 17 in stores on Saturday, as major retailer Restore: reported a sharp rise in pre-ordering this year.  Strong demand for Apple smartphones offers a sign that consumer demand for popular products has yet to falter in line with a wider economic slowdown in Russia.  The iPhones' popularity in Russia has endured Apple halting sales in 2022 and suspending services like Apple Pay in the wake of Western sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine.

headline: How Analysts See Apple’s Story Shifting With Services Growth and Mixed iPhone Demand
summary: Apple's consensus analyst price target saw only a slight uptick in the latest update, moving marginally from $236.19 to $240.69. This modest change reflects a balance of optimism about accelerating services growth and diminished market headwinds, while being tempered by mixed demand signals for upcoming iPhone models. Stay tuned to discover how investors can track these subtle but meaningful shifts in Apple's stock narrative moving forward. What Wall Street Has Been Saying Analyst reactions...

headline: HP’s AI PC Expansion Amid Apple Gains Might Change The Case For Investing In HP (HPQ)
summary: Recently, HP expanded its AI PC portfolio, increasing AI PC revenues and pushing shipments in this segment above 25% of its total mix, although its overall market share experienced a slight decline as rival Apple gained significant ground with its new M4 Mac models. An emerging industry trend is the growing demand for AI-powered PCs, driven in part by the upcoming end-of-service for Microsoft Windows 10, which has the potential to reshape competitive dynamics across the sector. We'll explore...
